body.p:
Columbia Ky
August 8th 1865
Govenor Bramblette
Dear Sir

Elsey Mcdonal and Milton B. Cox were jointly indicted in this court for robery. They had separate trials Mcdonal was tried first, and convicted, the case was prepared for the Court of Appeals but was not presented on account of his death, at the next Term Cox was tried, substantially the same evidence was given against ^him^ and for him, he was convicted.

His Father wishes to apply to you for his pardon, the record in the case of Mcdonal, he will present to you, I hope you will examine it, & will then dispose of his case as your good judgment may think you ought, Yours most respectfully

Govr Bramblette
Frankfort
Ky
M C. Cox
